author: alon.ssv.network
content:
Great thread everyone!
On the point of being able to change the destination eth1 address, i think it might be absolutely necessary. 
eth1 contracts might have vulnerabilities in them which might require them to be changed. We have enough examples the past few years. 

Being able to change the target eth1 address, IMO, is a security concern. I wouldn't want to get stuck with a compromised contract i can't change.
